column4: this is probably a dumb question, but my ubuntu machine has two 150g hard drives, currently with / on one and /home on the other, both ext3. Now obviously this is a huge waste of space on the first drive which has under 5g used, so I want to partition most of it off and use it for the /home tree. Is there any way to do this so that I don't have to manage which directories go on which drive manually, and just let the filesystem fi
With LVM, you can "treat" multiple hard drives as one gigantic partition or anything you desire.
